article.title: Two Companies to Deliver P-8A Application-based Architecture
article.text: Raytheon Company, Dallas, is being awarded a $15,494,873 cost-plus-incentive-fee contract to design, develop, demonstrate, document and deliver a P-8A application based architecture system. Lockheed Martin Corporation, Manassas, Virginia, is being awarded a $19,710,309 cost-plus-incentive-fee contract to design, develop, demonstrate, document and deliver a P-8A application based architecture system. The contracts were competitively procured via an electronic request for proposals and five offers were received. The Naval Air Systems Command, Patuxent River, Maryland, is the contracting activity (N00019-15-C-0021).
